item.title: Al Green Theatre (at the Miles Nadal Jewish Community Centre)
item.description: Located in the Miles Nadal Jewish Community Centre, the Al Green Theatre is a multi-purpose venue for film, theatre, dance, concerts, lectures, and social and corporate events.

item.title: Alumnae Theatre Company
item.description: Housed in an historic fire hall, Alumnae Theatre Company continues its original mandate to present the best in classic and contemporary plays and provide opportunities for all women in theatre.

item.title: Annex Theatre
item.description: The Annex Theatre is a democratic collective of theatre artists dedicated to creating bold new work in an environment of improbability, resourcefulness, and risk.

item.title: Berkeley Street Theatre
item.description: Home to two separate theatre spaces: the Berkeley Upstairs Theatre and the Berkeley Downstairs Theatre. The Berkeley site was originally built in 1887 as part of a gas pumping station and later converted to a theatre space. The theatre is home to the Canadian Stage Company which presents the richest variety of Canadian and international plays and musicals - edgy, provocative works.

item.title: Betty Oliphant Theatre (at Canada's National Ballet School)
item.description: Located in the R.A. Laidlaw Centre, the Betty Oliphant Theatre is a 265-seat proscenium arch theatre with a Georgian Court-style auditorium and a large fly tower. Tucked behind the faÃ§ade of two Victorian mansions, it was designed by Jack Diamond, who is one of Canada's premier architects.

item.title: Buddies in Bad Times Theatre
item.description: Established in 1979, Buddies in Bad Times Theatre is a professional Canadian theatre company dedicated to the development and presentation of queer theatre. It has evolved into the largest facility-based queer theatre company in the world and has made an unparalleled contribution to the recognition and acceptance of queer lives in Canada.

item.title: Canada's National Ballet School
item.description: Established in 1959, Canadaâ€™s National Ballet School is one of the worldâ€™s foremost training institutions for aspiring young dancers and teachers. Attracting students from across the country and around the world, NBS is the only ballet academy in North America to provide elite dance training, academic instruction and residential care on the same campus.

item.title: Dancemakers and the Centre for Creation
item.description: Dancemakers is a professional contemporary dance company that brings to its audiences dance of sophisticated physicality and emotional impact.

item.title: Ed Mirvish Theatre
item.description: At 2,300 seats, the elegant Ed Mirvish Theatre is a perfect setting for theatrical presentations, concerts, comedy, benefits, lectures, private functions - and much more - on a grand scale . It has been part of Toronto's entertainment scene since 1920.

item.title: Elgin and Winter Garden Theatre Centre
item.description: The Elgin and Winter Garden Theatre Centre is the last operating double-decker theatre in the world and features two completely separate and distinctive theatres. Year-round guided theatre tours of this National Historic Site are available.

item.title: Factory Theatre
item.description: This theatre has produced more than 150 new Canadian plays in mainstage and 500 more in workshop and other formats. Housed in an attractive Victorian mansion, the Factory Theatre operates as two theatre spaces.

item.title: Famous People Players
item.description: This shining jewel of family entertainment has its own special home, minutes from downtown Toronto, where children and adults alike can experience dazzling world-class artistry through a feast of all the five senses.

item.title: Four Seasons Centre for the Performing Arts
item.description: The Four Seasons Centre for the Performing Arts is a theatre built specifically for opera and ballet performances with the finest level of acoustics. The Canadian Opera Company and the National Ballet of Canada perform at this centre.

item.title: George Ignatieff Theatre
item.description: Combining day-time classes during the term with special events after hours makes the George Ignatieff Theatre a hub of the Trinity College community. The theatre is conveniently located for community groups that rent the facility on evenings, weekends, and in the summer.

item.title: Glenn Gould Studio (at the Canadian Broadcasting Centre)
item.description: Glenn Gould Studio is 'the jewel of the Canadian Broadcasting Centre' and continues to be one of Toronto's favourite venues for concert-goers. It is located on the main floor of the Canadian Broadcasting Centre and is a superb recording facility offering the sound isolation, state-of-the-art recording facilities and acoustics that are ideal for classical and jazz recordings.

item.title: Harbourfront Centre
item.description: Harbourfront Centre, on Toronto's waterfront, is an innovative not-for-profit cultural organization that creates events and activities of excellence that enliven, educate and entertain a diverse public.

item.title: Hart House Theatre
item.description: Hart House Theatre is the focal point for the performing arts at the University of Toronto with over a thousand students participating each year in its extra-curricular season of drama, dance, music and film.

item.title: Isabel Bader Theatre
item.description: This theatre has been used as a lecture hall for University of Toronto students, an active learning space for Victoria University students groups, numerous concerts, theatrical productions, film screenings, and conferences.

item.title: Koerner Hall
item.description: Part of the TELUS Centre for Performance and Learning in Toronto, Koerner Hall is a 1,135 seat venue designed in the tradition of the classic 'shoebox' venues of Europe, built without compromise and with a mission to provide acoustic perfection for music of all genres.

item.title: Lower Ossington Theatre
item.description: As a hub for the western downtown Toronto artistic community, this theatre houses rehearsals, presentations and classes to a number of community and arts groups.

item.title: Massey Hall
item.description: Declared a heritage building in the 1970s, Massey Hall presents the finest artists in classical music, jazz, pop, comedy, world music and dance.

item.title: Medieval Times Dinner and Tournament
item.description: Medieval Times Dinner and Tournament is a family dinner theatre featuring staged medieval-style games, sword-fighting, and jousting performed by a cast of actors and horses. The Toronto location is housed inside a Beaux-Arts structure built in 1912.

item.title: Mysteriously Yours ¦ Mystery Dinner Theatre
item.description: The mood is set as you enter this elegant, tiered-level dinner theatre and enjoy a fabulous, three-course, gourmet dinner! Participate and see if you can solve... WHODUNIT?!

item.title: Native Earth Performing Arts
item.description: Native Earth Performing Arts is a not-for-profit organization dedicated to the creating, developing and producing of professional artistic expression of the Aboriginal experience in Canada.

item.title: Panasonic Theatre
item.description: Originally built in 1911 as a private residence and then converted into a movie theatre in 1919 known as The Victory, The Panasonic is now owned by Mirvish Productions and is located in the heart of downtown Toronto.

item.title: Papermill Theatre (at Todmorden Mills)
item.description: The Papermill Theatre is a large, recently renovated space that seats 164 and offers a retractable seating unit, two fully furnished dressing rooms and an LCD projector.

item.title: Princess of Wales Theatre
item.description: This 2000-seat playhouse was built by the father and son producing team of David and Ed Mirvish. It was the first privately owned and financed theatre built in Canada since 1907 - and the first anywhere in North America in over 30 years. Its stage is one of the widest and deepest in North America.

item.title: Queen Elizabeth Theatre
item.description: The Queen Elizabeth Theatre is Toronto's newest live music concert venue. Nestled between BMO Field and the Press Building at Exhibition Place, its high ceiling and soft seats provide an ideal concert venue for mid-sized acts.

item.title: Randolph Academy of the Performing Arts
item.description: Housed within the Randolph Centre for the Arts, the Randolph Academy for the Performing Arts is a gathering place for those who have a passion for the performing arts and seek an outlet for creative expression. The Academyâ€™s home is steeped in the history of theatre in Canada. Known collectively as the Bathurst Street Theatre, it has been a landmark roadhouse for original Canadian theatre since the 1960s.

item.title: Roy Thomson Hall
item.description: Roy Thomson Hall opened in the fall of 1982 and has since hosted hundreds of world-renowned artists and performers over the years. It is the home of the Toronto Symphony Orchestra and the Toronto Mendelssohn Choir. I

item.title: Royal Alexandra Theatre
item.description: A masterpiece of beaux-arts architecture, the historic theatre is Toronto's senior theatre and never having been converted to any other use, it is the oldest continuously operating legitimate theatre in North America.

item.title: Ryerson Theatre
item.description: This theatre is used for external theatrical productions from opera to concerts of all types, and for staging the productions of Ryerson Theatre and Fashion Schools.

item.title: Scarborough Village Theatre
item.description: Theatre Scarborough (Playhouse 66) is an umbrella organization consisting of Scarborough Music Theatre, Scarborough Players, and Scarborough Theatre Guild. Performances take place at the Scarborough Village Community Centre.

item.title: Solar Stage Children's Theatre
item.description: Solar Stage provides very unique theatrical presentations that enrich the lives of small children and much bigger adults.

item.title: Sony Centre for the Performing Arts
item.description: Canada's largest performing arts venue, the Sony Centre hosts a variety of entertainment including dance, musical concerts, spectacles and popular children's shows.

item.title: St. Lawrence Centre for the Arts
item.description: As a focus of Canadian performing arts, the Centre takes a leadership role in providing Toronto residents, visitors and diverse cultural communities with a professional, service-oriented theatrical and entertainment facility.

item.title: Tarragon Theatre
item.description: The Tarragon Theatre is one of the main centres for contemporary playwriting in the country. It is well known for its development, creation and encouragement of new work. Over 170 works have premiered at Tarragon.

item.title: The Danforth Music Hall
item.description: The Music Hall boasts new theatre seats, state-of-art sound and lighting and a completely renovated backstage area. In 2009, The Music Hall celebrated its 90th anniversary.

item.title: The Second City
item.description: Beginning as a small cabaret theatre on Chicago's north side in 1959, The Second City has grown to become a comedy empire - building a robust business based on its core improvisational methodologies. It specializes in sketch comedy and improv.

item.title: The Theatre Centre
item.description: The Theatre Centre is a nationally-recognized arts incubator, serving as a research and development hub for the cultural sector by providing space, subsidy and mentorship to new generations of arts leaders.

item.title: The Village Playhouse
item.description: Begun as a community theatre in the Bloor West Village 27 years ago, the Village Players Theatre Company presents pleasant dramas and comedies.

item.title: Theatre Passe Muraille
item.description: Theatre Passe Muraille develops and produces innovative and provocative Canadian theatre and nurtures new theatre artists and theatre companies. Theatre Passe Muraille is housed in a designated historical building.

item.title: Toronto Centre for the Arts
item.description: This venue features three unique stages to house a multitude of events from orchestral and rock concerts to big-budget musicals to community and corporate events to gala fundraisers.

item.title: Winchester Street Theatre
item.description: The Winchester Street Theatre is owned and jointly operated by the Toronto Dance Theatre and the School of Toronto Dance Theatre. The venue features rake seating and a stage that best showcases dance performances.

item.title: Young Centre for the Performing Arts
item.description: Anchored by the presence of Soulpepper's year-round classical repertory and George Brown College's Theatre School, the Young Centre provides a home for the leading artists and arts organizations of our city across all performance disciplines.

item.title: Young People's Theatre
item.description: The Young Peoples Theatre is the largest Theatre for Young Audiences (TYA) company in Canada and a significant institution in the Canadian professional theatre community.

item.title: Yuk Yuk's
item.description: Canada's national stand up comedy clubs. Live, un-cut comedy.
